Hi Igor,  
  
Thanks a lot for help! Now the Heritrix works fine (I've adde=
d  
PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule).  
  
As I understand, if I want to proce=
ss not only html files (and also  
jsp, php, etc.), I should set such regul=
ar expression:  
  
^(?i)^.*\.(?:html?|?:jsp?|?:php?|doc|ppt)$ ,  
  
and i=
f there are URLs like "http://some.domain.com/page.jsp?id=3D3" or  
"http:/=
/some.domain.org/page.php?id=3D10", to process such URL's I  
should set su=
ch regular expression:  
  
^(?i)^.*\.(?:html?|?:jsp?.*|?:php?.*|doc|ppt)$ =
.  
  
The last two questions I have are:  
1) What the regular expression =
(?:html?) does mean?  
(html?) means that html can appear once or not at al=
l,  
and (?:html) means that html, as a non-capturing group (what does it  =

mean)?  
  
2) Is it possible to use seeds in old manner in this case (I m=
ean  
http://yahoo.com instead of http://yahoo.com/index.html)? 
It's possi=
ble that I don't know beforehand the start page of the 
site (index.html, i=
ndex.php, or something else). 
 
Thanks a lot again. 
  
Regards,  
Artem. =
 
   
--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Igor Ranitovic <igor@...>   
=
wrote:   
>   
> Hi Artem,   
>    
> If your seeds don't end with html?|do=
c|ppt|swf then you will get   
-5000.   
> But I believe that the rule sequ=
ence will do what you want --   
> everything from certain domain(s) ending=
 with specified file   
extensions.   
>    
> Try adding index.html to you=
r seeds. For example:    
> http://yahoo.com/index.html instead of http://y=
ahoo.com/   
>    
> Also, it seems that you are missing PrerequisiteAccept=
DecideRule.   
You    
> should probably add this rule as the last rule in =
the sequence.   
> This will allow fetching of mandatory prerequisites (dns=
 and   
robots.txt).   
>    
> Take care,   
> i.
